title: Reculver Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.caption: A reservoir near Reculver

images.title: Richard Dorrell / Northern Sea Wall, Reculver
images.caption: Northern Sea Wall. Part of the Thanet Coastal Path, this picture looks east towards Birchington. On this murky January day, the view is lost in the mist. On the right is the Reculver oyster farm.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Roman Wall, Reculver Roman Fort. This is all that remains of Regvlbivm. The fort once stood on a headland overlooking the Wantsum channel, separating Kent from the Isle of Thanet. The channel as long since silted up & filled in.

images.title: Richard Dorrell / Rushbourne Sea Wall, Reculver
images.caption: Rushbourne Sea Wall. Looking towards the twin towers of St Mary's Church (square TR2269) with the oyster farm on the right.

images.title: John Salmon / View to car park from St Mary's Church, Reculver, Kent
images.caption: View to car park from St Mary's Church

images.title: Towards Thanet by E Gammie, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Towards Thanet

description: This country park is located on the Kent coast at Reculver. The cliff top views over Herne Bay are fantastic with a wide variety of wildlife and plantlife to see. The Reculver Towers are also located in the park. They are an important local landmark and are listed as a Scheduled Ancient Monument. The park also includes the Bishopstones Nature Reserve where you can look out for wildlife including Sand martins, skylarks, meadow pipits and corn buntings. The route below is designed for walkers as it takes you along footpaths around the park but there is a cycle route running right through the park. The park is located just a few miles from Herne Bay so you could visit the park by following the coast path on our Herne Bay to Reculver Walk or head to the delightful coastal town of Whitstable on our Whitstable to Herne Bay Walk .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a nice on site cafe selling drinks and snacks. You could also visit The King Ethelbert Inn which is right next to the park.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is very popular with dog walkers so you'll probably see other owners on your visit. The King Ethelbert mentioned above is also dog friendly.

display_address: Reculver Lane, Reculver, Hillborough, Canterbury, Kent, England, CT6 6SS, United Kingdom
